storyInfo: After seeing that the Law's true form is a machine, Arturia decides to leave, while Federico and Andoain step forward for an audience. The rebels place down barrier after barrier. Exusiai tries to attack the First Saint, but the procession of pilgrims seems to be unstoppable.

attributes.content: (Gahâ€”)
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I can only provide first aid right now.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Andoain, unrestrained usage of luminescent Originium Arts has irreparably damaged your optic nerves.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I do not have the ability to heal these injuries. Once conditions allow for it, you need medical treatment.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Don't worry.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: The path ahead has already revealed itself. We don't need eyes to see the way.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Follow the cursor running along the ground... This maze is too complex, and I cannot maintain my Arts for very long.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Let us go.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It's here.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Even if this is not the source of the calamity, what lies behind the door may be able to give us answers.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Follow me, Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico does not receive a response.
Ever since he caught up with her outside the Shrine of Nurtury, she has been exceedingly cooperative.
But now, the black-haired Sankta stands several steps behind him, gracefully drawing her bow across her cello's strings, with no intention of following him.
I really do intend to escape this time, Fede.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Andoain is hurt, and you're alone. There's no better opportunity than this, is there?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We have arrived at the door to the truth, Arturia. You know that your actions lack meaning.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Truth...? Meaning...?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You really are the best of the executors, a walking law book, the first saint from outside the ranks of Pope... Truly worthy of the code name Executor.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Your rationality, your callousness, even the doubts you hold about these two traits of yours are all in service to the continuation of the Law.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If that is what the Holy City itself is, maybe you're the only one who can understand Him, haha.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: As for you, Senior Andoain... You'll have to forgive me. It was never part of my plan, but when you were using your Arts earlier, I inadvertently touched upon the whispers of your heart.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It is complex, more complex than those of many people I know. But... not particularly unusual.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: An overly inflexible melody leads them to all become adaptations or repetitions of the same tune. They sayâ€”
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Your beginning and your end both lie in Laterano.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But you may find yourself alone at that point.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Ah, I beg your pardon, if you have taken offense.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: (Nods) Arturia, this 'offense' you speak of, was it not a chance for me to perform a different sort of confession?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: As for those last words of yours, I would rather treat them as a blessing. They stand as proof that I have reached the end.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Ooh, what an interesting answer.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia turns away.
Not everyone is so obsessed with the truth and meaning behind Laterano.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: At the very least, I'm not that interested.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I got a little peek at Him just now. Behind that door lies... a machine, right?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: In that case, the answer is bound to be boring.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Think back to our time in ZwillingstÃ¼rme, Fede.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A calamity of similar scale struck the city, and in the chaos, the people lost their way or struggled and raged... At this very moment, there are millions of hearts in Laterano that demand appreciation.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If you turn away now, Arturia, it means you will have to face our enemies in this maze alone.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You need someone to lure them away, don't you?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Your patron firearm is lost. You have no way to defend yourself.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Perhaps I can find a way to turn them into my audience?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Don't worry about me, Fede. The Lateran did designate me a dangerous element.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Situation assessment: high-risk. Probability of survival: low. Executor's decision... You may leave.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hah.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Time waits for nobody, you two. If you don't plan on leaving yourselves, no need to see me off.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Well then, farewell, my beloved little frater.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...All that pontificating just to say you want us to go help the Curia?
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: Full marks for listening comprehension.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: No way.
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: Eh?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: It's not our responsibility, Mostima.
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: Half of the people here were kicked out of Laterano by the Curia in the first place. Maybe it was because they Fell, or because of Oripathy...
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: As for the other half, they chose to leave Laterano, whether out of despair or doubt... not that it really matters.
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: Hah, then why come back now?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Because our halos started acting weird and breaking. Is that so hard to understand?
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: We're not a part of Laterano anymore. Alieni, even.
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: Doesn't matter if you chose to leave or if you were forced to, we all cut our connections with this city. But even after all these years, its changes still affect us, and they just never stop...
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: Spurcissime! Damn this stupid halo, damn it!
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: Sounds like there's no way to resolve all your complaints, even if we got every Notarial Hall executor out here.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: That's why we came back, to settle things!
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: Did I tell you to save anything?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: My sob story is that I Fell during an accident in the line of duty. After that, I became a Legatus, mostly so I didn't have to stay in Laterano all the time.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: I'm one hundred percent Alienus too.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: There's no-one else who understands you better right now, amici.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Maybe the glitchy halos got you seeing Laterano in an extra-bad light, spurring you to come back...
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: If you came back out of hate, or pain, or despair... then you'd best come with me to block that procession.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Because the people who caused that hate, that pain, that despair? They're in that crowd over there. Go ahead, use bullets, explosives, whatever. Get your revenge however you like. Just make sure to give them a hard time!
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: You're all talk, Mostima.
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: Drat, you found me out.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: But something's gotta be done. Besides, you're already here, aren't you?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Hey, Nueda.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Keep going down this alley, then find an empty house to hole up in. It's not a good idea for a lone nun and a bunch of kids to run around the place.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: This place is a decent distance from where the procession's headed. Monsters probably won't come running here.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: Are you and your friends also going to help save Laterano, Patia?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Heh, us Pathfinders aren't that noble.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: But our leader's chosen to wade into the depths of this disaster. We can't exactly sit back and watch, can we?
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: He told us the place he was going wasn't suited for numbers, so we'll do what we can out here.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: As for you, Sister...
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: I will protect the children, no matter if they are from Laterano, or BolÃ­var.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: (Fervent prayers)
attributes.name: Enlightened Creatures

attributes.content: These freaks started chittering like mad the moment the Tower's big bell stopped ringing... It's pissing me off!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: I don't care what your sales pitch is, I DON'T WANT A STUPID HALO!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: (Fervent prayers)
attributes.name: Enlightened Creatures

attributes.content: I swear, these faex just keep coming and coming...
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: You've got three seconds to get out of there, Fiammetta.
Three seconds?! Hey, how am Iâ€”
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: How was that? Got you in the nick of time!
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Do you think everyone can go as fast as you or something?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Never mind. The situation up ahead's a complete mess. Even the Tower of Revelations's bell has gone silent. We've lost Pagus Ecclesia.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: They'll be in Pagus Michaelion soon... If that monster can flatten one of our barricades with a single stomp, I don't think the Notarial Hall's defenses will be much use.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Blocking them's no good. If we can't use more destructive methods, we might not be able to slow them down at all.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Agreed.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: So, where're your reinforcements?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Let's get moving, amici.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: I'm sure you've all been to Michaelion before. Might have been for the firearms workshop, might have been for the Notarial Hall.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: The last thing many of you fallen angels did before getting kicked out of Laterano was probably handing over your guardian gun to the authorities.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Then you would've seen those gun-toting statues around the doors of every workshop... Hmm, come to think of it, the Notarial Hall's got a pair of cannons at theirs...
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Wait, we don't have the right permissions to get those statues to fireâ€”
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: That's something for Lemuen to solve.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Alright, get those statues knocked over and their guns pointed at the street!
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Let's make up for all those gunshots we haven't heard over the years!
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Mmph...
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Holy smokes, your skin can stop bullets? Talk about thick-skinned!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Man, an entire volley didn't even scratch you...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Last time I felt like this, I was gaming with the boss. He went around back and cranked the difficulty up to max, couldn't clear it even after spending all night on it... Sure was discouraging!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Discouraging? Hardly. What I see is that your attitude and emotions are unaffected by the shattering of your halo.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Stand atop my shoulder, child.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: From the Tower of Revelations to the Notarial Hall in Pagus Michaelion, every lamp along the road has lit up...
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Our newborn comrades are bringing light to this city, little by little.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Like our journey countless eons ago.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: For the sake of true paradise, we crossed treacherous ravines and traversed barren wastes, searching for the slumbering silver mounts.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: The only difference is that this time, we are certain He is there.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Salvation is our inevitable endpoint. Laterano shall never fall into night.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: To move onwards is the only choice this city has now.
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Yet you still wish to resist an entire procession, an entire race, an entire city by yourself?
attributes.name: 'Saint'

attributes.content: Ah, I finally get to hear life's most relaxing sound. Now this is Laterano!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Say, if I really am on my own, then where'd that explosion come from?
attributes.name: Exusiai
Exusiai
attributes.content: I might not know who I'm fighting alongside, but I'll leave the monster-hunting to them. As for what I'm gonna do...

attributes.name: Exusiai
attributes.content: I'm gonna keep you company the whole way through!
What exactly is calamity? What exactly is the future?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: And why exactly have you decided what you're doing is salvation, or the only choice?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Hmm, going to go help her?
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: No need. She's just dealing with a stubborn child.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Who's stopping the procession from advancing?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Mostima and Fiammetta have banded together with a group of fresh returnees. As for Andoain and Federico, we don't know where they or their group are.
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: Fia...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Once more must I stand against those I hold dear. Life is such a fickle thing.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Reverend Patrizion?
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: Just focus on your own work, Velliv.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: I've managed to build a rapport with the enlightened creatures, and I've shown them our route. Our empathy's become stronger and more distinct, almost like it's not even empathy anymore...
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: If it is as the Matriarchâ€”no, the Saint said, then this is what empathy should really be.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Which means what she showed us before was true. Calamity really does exist, and only through these extreme methods can Laterano be saved.
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: But right now...
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: The dream has collapsed, after all.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: This chaos is only temporary. Continue onwards. We can no longer be stopped.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: We must ensure the Saint reaches the Basilica. That way, she can continue with the Nativity after it was so rudely interrupted.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: We still have time to make an even better Laterano... to take care of everything that stands in our way.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: (Bzzzzâ€”Bzzzzbzzzzzâ€”)
attributes.name: Unknown Voice Over The Radio

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: It's been a while, you old bastard.
attributes.name: Unknown Voice Over The Radio

attributes.content: You'd best stop right there. I have your throat in my sights.
attributes.name: Unknown Voice Over The Radio

attributes.content: A while indeed... Aurela.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: In the deepest depths of the Basilica, at the end of the labyrinth, the final door opens wide for Federico and Andoain.

Behind the door, a cold machine, shaped like a ring, sits in the dead center of a platform. A strange red glare seeps out of its innards, sweeping across every inch of the room, accompanied by an audible buzzing.
Sure signs of 'calculation.'
Your Holiness?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Beneath the platform, the old man stands in silence.

He stands with his eyes shut tight, his robes covered in a thick layer of dust. There is no reaction as the pair approach, not the slightest hint of movement from him, as if he were an unseeing, unhearing rock.
But...
But his cracked, peeling lips still quiver. He mumbles to himself, yet cannot utter a single sound.
The sitting Pope, Yvangelista XI, stands silently before God.
Clear signs of aphasia and neurodegeneration. Preliminary judgment: His Holiness's body and mind are on the brink of collapse.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But the dream covering the city has crumbled. Why is he not awake?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Maybe he came here for the same reason we did.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: He just hasn't found the answer he's looking for yet.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.text: \n\nJudgment: able to assist in bringing the Transfiguration to completion.

attributes.content: 'Suitable'?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Does it have something to do with your title of saint? But why me, then...?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.text: Suitable candidates are particular individuals situated on the edge of the calculation model.
\n\nRequired as samples for participation in interactive simulation, to verify model integrity.

attributes.content: His Holiness discussed my sainthood with me several times, but he never elaborated on the details.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Perhaps he was also unsure as to what the true duties of a saint are.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But if the Law sees us as 'suitable candidates', entrusting us with a specific duty... Then saint or not, we are now responsible for It.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.text: \n\nPCS authorization released. Permission to enter granted.
\n\nPCS will synchronize any necessary prerequisite information with you.

attributes.content: The machine's voice echoes around the room. It is steady, unvarying, untarnished by emotion or gender, yet it still contains an indescribable sense of might and authority.
Now that I've come this far, do I still seek answers from Him?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Maybe He seeks answers from us. Since we are 'particular individuals'. His 'samples'.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Situation assessment: unknown. Risk assessment: unknown. Executor's decision... We proceed.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The two Sanktas walk side by side past Yvangelista XI, toward the cold machine, toward two shining ports.
